meanings.definition: To publicly recommend or praise someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys preconizing her favorite books to her friends.
meanings.sent2: The author is preconizing the benefits of a healthy lifestyle in his latest article.
meanings.sent3: The teacher preconized the importance of studying for the upcoming test.
meanings.sent4: His actions preconize his dedication to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The coach preconizes hard work and perseverance to achieve success.

meanings.definition: The act of publicly recommending or praising someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her preconizing of the new restaurant attracted many customers.
meanings.sent2: The preconizing of the charity event helped raise awareness.
meanings.sent3: The preconizing of the award-winning movie made everyone excited to watch it.
meanings.sent4: The preconizing of the talented artist brought in a large crowd to the gallery.
meanings.sent5: His preconizing of the local businesses boosted their sales.
